title: How the Amish Raise Millions of Chickens for Meat and Egg Production

subtasks: Observe the selection of chicken breeds, including Rhode Island Reds and Cornish Crosses.
Monitor the construction and maintenance of Amish chicken coops.
Evaluate the feeding methods, including the use of kitchen scraps and grains.
Assess the role of natural foraging in chicken diets and egg quality.
Analyze the integration of light cycles in hen management for egg production.
Observe techniques for sustainable coop design and waste management.
Document Amish methods for egg and meat quality assurance.
Investigate community-based chicken processing events and their significance.
Recognize the challenges and adaptive strategies of Amish chicken farmers.
Reflect on the Amish approach to land and resource stewardship.
